title: What does the negative sign in front of the kinetic energy term in Schrodinger’s equation signify? - Quora

response.answer_text: In quantum mechanics every measurable quantity (observables)is written in form of an operator which when act on the Eigen state gives the corresponding Eigen value of the observable.now the kinetic energy which is p^2/2m,here p in operator form is written as h/ (2πi* del operator)..you can find this operator notation by using commutation relation of position and momentum…
The negative sing shows that when electrons revolves in 3D in the shell it will loose it's KE.
